name: Chicago Marriott Downtown Magnificent Mile

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Mariott over a long weekend. The staff was very friendly. When we checked in my wife needed band aids and we asked where the gift shop was and the front desk person had them sent up. Within two minutes of arriving at our room, they knocked ont he door with the band aids.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The room was nice, but very samll. It was basically big enough for one king bed and a chair. The TV reception was cloudy on a lot of the channels, and there were even blank channels when you were scrolling through. We got both breakfast and dinner once from room service, and both times the food arrived promptly and was very good.
reviews.title: Okay but not great

reviews.text: The location is great, right next to a mall and right in the middle of all the shopping on Michigan Avenue.
reviews.title: An Excellent Time

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel for years [and in fact lived across the street from it when I lived in Chicago]. The hotel has gone downhill over those years. Service is an issue. For example, housekeeping in an effort to get their work done tried to get into my room to clean at 7:30 am when i was in the shower. Coffee requested for the next morning could not be delivered 1/2 hour earlier when called. Bar food order for a basic burger took almost 40 minutes. And clock was unplugged in my room when i got there, and the outlets were poorly grounded. So I don't give the hotel the benefit of the doubt anymore after this stay.
reviews.title: Very comfortable
Great location--All else as expected
reviews.text: Overall, there is much that needs to be focused upon to get this place back up to snuff. If you have a choice, stay at the Intercontinental across the street. Much more customer focused, up to date, and reliable. If the Marriott infuses some cash and training into this place, it might go back up to four stars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights here and the mattress was heavenly. Very plush. It was also nice that although we were 32 floors up, you had the option of sliding the glass to get some fresh air.
reviews.title: Rock star mattress

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the middle of the action and walking distance to Millennium Park and Navy Pier. Many excellent restaurants are in the surrounding 3 blocks.
reviews.title: Great location for a business traveler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was great. The concierge service was very helpful. The lobby bar was very lively and reminded me of a Vegas lobby bar. However, our room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.text: I'm relatively local to the area, but stayed in this hotel for a recent business meeting. The location is fantastic with tons of great restaurants and bars in the area. You're within walking distance (albeit a bit of a walk) to the theatre district and great shopping on Michigan Avenue and State Street. There's a great lobby / bar to relax in, and the restaurant's menu looked like it fit right in with the area - I can imagine people not staying at the hotel eating there. The only downsides I would give the property are that the rooms are a bit smaller (especially the bathrooms) and there's a fair bit of "street noise." There's a fire station a few blocks away, and I could hear the sirens multiple times at night. I imagine there's soundproofing that has been done, but more would be better.
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and me spent 3 nights at athe Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile. It's a beautiful hotel with spacious rooms. The bathrooms are a little small, but overall it is very nice. The location is perfect and within malking distance to the Navy Pier and Millenium Park. It's approximately a 45 minute walk to the zoo, which is free to visit. It's close to lots of restaurants and pubs. The buffet breakfast is amazing with plenty of choices. The only two criticisms I have are they do not provide complimentary internet in your rooms. However, you can access your internet from the lobby or the 2nd floor which is where the restaurant is located.
reviews.title: Awesome weekend

reviews.text: My wife, I and three children stayed at the Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile. We live close to the city but wanted to take my wife downtown for mother's day so she could relax and shop (and that she did). I read some reviews before we visited the hotel and I could not disagree with them more. The room was very adequate with a king size bed and a sleeper sofa. The kids slept fine on the pull out and the king bed was awesome! There was no renvovation taking place when we stayed. The room was well appointed, staff were friendly and they have a full service Starbucks in the lobby. They have a nice swimming pool and hot tub which is a must with children. Plus, you absolutely cannot beat the location. We'd stay here again in a heart beat. I noticed people complained about the elevators and the wait. They must not visit big cities often. When you have thousands of people trying to get on and off an elevator, it does take a bit of time. Especially if you are trying to use it in the morning when people are checking in/out. You are on vacation; relax.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: My husband had to go to Chicago for a 2 day conference, so my 2yr old son and I decided to tag along. The best feature about hotel is location. It is close to Millenium Park, Navy Pier, and of course all the shopping on the Magnificent mile. Hotel is still under construction and we saw workers in the lobby. Our Room was on the small side but I think that is standard in those downtown hotels. It had nice new flat screen TV, but no mini bar or coffee mashine. Bathroom was clean, but showerhead screamed for replacement. My main complaint was that it was soooooo cold. We even called the staff to help adjust heating, but nothing helped. My husband also complained that it was very cold where all the lectures were. Hotel has a nice pool on 9th floor, water was luke warm, whirlpool a little better, but air temperature again was too cold. Outside was cold too so we would go to nearby Nordstrom to warm up. Restaurant at the hotel was small. We only tried breakfast buffet since we did not like lunch and dinner menues. Fortunately there are fabolous restaurants just few blocks away.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: My fiance and myself visited this hotel through a work function. It was very easy to find although beware, if you are driving, the entrance is actually on Rush St. We used valet parking and it went fine, as check in did as well. I don't think I have ever checked into a hotel quite so quickly! The service was wonderful. My only problem...the rooms are SO small. We only stayed one night, I couldn't fathom staying another as I was getting claustrophobic. My fiance and I couldn't even pass between the dresser and bed at the same time! The room was very clean, as was the bathroom, we found no problems in that area, we just couldn't move around! We finally started climbing over the bed to get to the other side of the room! I didn't take any pics of the room, I couldn't find a good view. My meeting was at the hotel and it was fine, check out was easy. The only problem we encountered with that was getting our car back from valet, the lady was extremely rude!
reviews.title: It was ok

likes.disliked: — room size, lady at valet desk

reviews.text: This location is on the Magnificent Mile and is close to everything. There are subway stations close, too, so you can get to and from the airport easily.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Room, Friendly staff
Terrible Stay, Never stay there
reviews.text: The room was clean, looked modern, and was comfortable. They only had one towel in the room, so we had to call for more, but they were brought up promptly.

Our hotel was in the heart of downtown close to the restaurants, bars and shops which was definitely a plus given the fact that we were in Chicago to visit the city and experience the nightlife. The room was spotless, clean and well kept. The best part was the spectacular view of downtown from the 24th floor. Breakfast spread was huge. All in all, an excellent place to stay if you are looking to party in the heart of downtown Chicago.
reviews.title: Awesome experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has 1200 rooms and all of them were booked for Labor Day weekend. I was very concerned this would be a less than terrific experience. Nothing could be further from the truth. All of the Marriott employees we encountered, we professional and went out of their way to make our stay very comfortable. Did I mention the hotel was FULL?
reviews.title: Fabulous location.....................

reviews.text: The location is on the Magnificent Mile in the heart of downtown Chicago. Everything was literally steps away from the hotel. We ate at two FABULOUS restaurants just down the street! My wife seemed to be in shoppers heaven given all of the stores at her feet. Millennium Park, the museums, the river, Soldier's Field and all just minutes away. I have stayed at several spots in Chicago on previous trips but none with a location as good as this.
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean, stunning, perfect location and fitness facilities are an added bonus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nice, standard Marriott fare. The breakfast and evening offering in the Concierge Lounge were all terrific. Great breakfast choices and equally good evening "snacks" and sweets. Tough choice to stay in and partake of the great food offered or go out and sample local fare. Now THIS is a tough call. Do both and see what you think.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Terrific hotel. Terrific location. Terrific time!
reviews.title: Wow felt like a VIP

reviews.text: This review is written by a business traveller that frequents Hilton and Marriott hotels throughout the US.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for Magnificent Mile

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, renovation, conceirge lounge (for elite members), and beds.
likes.disliked: — Room may be located a fair distance form the elevators.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
reviews.title: Magnificent Marriott Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent choice for those staying downtown, wanting to be on Magnificent Mile. Service is top-notch, facilities and rooms are excellent. Views from high-floor rooms are excellent. Recommended to friends and family.
reviews.title: Hate the elavators!

reviews.text: FEATURES / PROS
reviews.title: Don't celebrate New Years Eve here!!!

reviews.text: - contemporary / relative-new decor in all in-room and common areas.
reviews.title: Magical Christmas

likes.disliked: — food and snack options in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical Marriott property that gets a lot of foot traffic given the proximity to Michigan Ave. You will wait, sometimes for several minutes, on an elevator during peak hours. Rooms are OK, nothing special. Service at the Starbucks is horrible. Beware.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Husband's bucket list was to go to Wrigley Field to see Cubs game in Chicago. The hotel experience made our 3 day visit more enjoyable than expected. The staff mapped out things to do for the ladies and location could not have been better on Michigan Ave. Rooms were lovely and comfortable. Very little noise from other rooms near us. Food in hotel very good and wonderful suggestions of restaurants from staff. Everyone made us feel special and very friendly....management has done a terrific job in training every level of employees. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Fabulous Experience

reviews.text: This property was selected as the conference location for a national organization's annual conference. The lobby was fine but the guestrooms and conference space are very dated. Circa 1980's. Very shabby and tired. Truly needs a renovation. It is also very noisy in the guest rooms so one listened to the sirens that wailed all night long which made it very hard to get a good night's rest. The food at the conference was inedible. Such a shame as the conference focus was food and events! WiFi was a major issue. No one could access service in the meeting spaces. It ended up draining everyone's power. Very frustrating.
reviews.title: Tired, tired, tired....

reviews.text: The location is terrific. Definitely convenient. And the staff was cordial.
reviews.title: Family vacation in the heart of Chicago

reviews.text: For goodness sake, renovate!!!!!! And do something with that banquet kitchen issue!!!!!
reviews.title: Great location, very nice place

reviews.text: Stayed three nights and overall had a good experience. Was on the 42nd floor facing west (away from the lake) with a good city view. The room was clean but felt rather cramped with a king bed. The concierge lounge, interestingly, is on the 4th floor, in what used to be one of the restaurants. It is large, quiet, and well-staffed. The breakfast is simply the complete buffet served at the adjoining restaurant (Ventuso); quite a deal considering it costs $17.95 if you had to pay. The evening snack is always cheese/crackers/fruit, salad, and one hot pasta--good, not great. Dessert was simply cookies, brownies, and mini-cheesecakes. The lounge was not open on Sat or Sun morning and coupons were not offered to MR elite (Gold) members.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The fitness center included a cardio room and a weight room, separated by a small indoor pool. The cardio machines worked well and ventilation in the room was superior to the usual claustrophobic atmosphere of hotel fitness rooms.
reviews.title: Marriott Magnificent Mile ~ Stay Here While in Chicago

reviews.text: Next door to the Hotel was the Westfield Shopping Center, which housed Nordstrom's, and had a decent foodcourt. There are many good restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel Stay

reviews.text: For those interested in the big 3 museum attractions (Field's, Shedd's, and Adler) there is a CTA bus that runs on Michigan Ave, on the same side of the Hotel, that will drop you off at the front entrance, much closer than the train will get you.
reviews.title: Will definitely choose again
Nice Staff, Noisy Room Near Elevator Shaft
reviews.text: In summary, a great location for an above-average convention hotel. Would stay again for the right price.

The construction continues at the Marriott downtown Chicago. Let’s be honest, for those of us that travel a lot, we can view construction as a double edged sword – something that you have to put up with if you expect a property to be new and updated but it can be a painful experience. Unfortunately, this is not the only problem that this hotel faces.
reviews.title: Underwhelmed...and it is not just the construction

reviews.text: The Marriott has completed some of their updating – with my room having the new carpet, new bathroom fixtures and in general much better than the last time I was here.
reviews.title: terrible...stay away!

reviews.text: Check in was slow, and some of this is due to the temporary check in desk. One can only hope that this process will improve when they get permanent facilities, but one also wonders why it is as slow as it is.
reviews.title: Avoid until construction complete
Huge Disappointment - "Under Renovation"
reviews.text: WARNING – for those of you that are quiet sleepers, do NOT take a room near the elevators. I had room 4x12 (forty some odd floors up) which apparently backs to the elevator shaft. It is not the “ding” of the elevators that are the problem, it is the noise itself caused by the elevator going up and down. I checked in very late, and didn’t pay much attention to it, and was too tired to change rooms. BIG mistake. As it turns out, I had to take the ironing board off the hooks in the closet to reduce the vibration of the ironing board caused by the elevator.

Needless to say, I moved rooms the next morning to 3x20 (thirty some odd floors up). The noise did improve quite a bit, but even several rooms away from the elevator shafts, you can still hear the noise. I feel sorry for those people that are in rooms ending in 12 or the other rooms that are very close to the elevators. Of course, if noise doesn’t bother you, then you are fine.
reviews.title: Travelers Beware

reviews.text: I attended a conference which was held in this hotel and stayed for three nights. I have stayed in many hotels in Chicago and the Marrott has one of the best locations. It also has comfortable, cheerful rooms, with great views on the upper floors. However that about sums up the few positive aspects of the hotel. There were many things I did not like about this Marriott:
reviews.title: Not worth paying full price

reviews.text: Slow elevators, as pointed out by many other posters.
reviews.title: Does not belong on the Magnificent Mile!

reviews.text: No security
reviews.title: Really enjoyed my stay

likes.liked: — Location, hotel and room cleanliness and decor

reviews.text: Poor temperature controls in the rooms and public spaces
reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!

reviews.text: Bathrooms are the size of a small closet
reviews.title: NOt worth it

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott Aug 12-14. Absolutely loved this hotel. My girlfriend and I went for a girl's weekend away and thought the location was just perfect for what we needed. Shopping right there & close to everything. We walked all over even to Navy Pier.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
MAGNIFICENT MILE OVERLOOK
reviews.text: At night it was so nice to crawl into the big comfy bed and we slept like babies. For us it worked. Only thing to complain about is not knowing where everything was, our room at least, did not have any info on what the hotel offered. When we go back we will once again stay at the Marriott.
We stayed at the Marriott Hotel in Chicago the 2nd week of July(06) and had a pleasant stay.The room was standard but the view on the 35th floor looking east to the lake was great.
reviews.title: This is the hotel if you're staying downtown

reviews.text: The bathroom was small by any standard and unvented.
reviews.title: Everything else is great but the rooms

reviews.text: The pool was good and the fitness room excellent.
reviews.title: Great Location, Average Hotel

reviews.text: I'm a huge Marriott fan and a Silver Elite Rewards member, so I always stay at the Marriott. But this visit left something to be desired.
reviews.title: Not What I Expected

reviews.text: I was there during construction in February 2008. It was still a nice hotel in terms of asthetics though. The decor was nice. I had a high floor room with floor to ceiling windows and a great view of Chicago. You're footsteps from all the action. Room service was tasty and the customer service was great. Those are the good things.
reviews.title: Renovated-review

reviews.text: But now the bad. My window had a wicked draft...to the point that I had to bundle up while working on my computer on the desk. Speaking of the computer, I had a broken ethernet cable, which knocked me off line every 20 minutes. This was very inconvenient because I was there on a business trip. The walls were paper thin. I could hear everything my neighbor did. And the heating system was super noisy. Every time the heat would come on, there was a huge noise and the blowing air was very loud. I had trouble sleeping, even though I am not a light sleeper. The valet lines were insane. Sometimes it took 20 minutes to get your car. And the check out line was nuts...about 20-30 minutes to get the updated bill. It made me wish I hadn't ordered breakfast that morning.
reviews.title: Very Good! Friendly Staff. Nicely Renovated. Location great!

likes.disliked: — Restaurant prices seemed a little high, which is why I didn't go there. $15 for breakfast?

reviews.text: To Marriott's credit, they quickly addressed the situation when I wrote to them. They awarded me 5,000 Marriott points. They gave my coworker, who had some of the same complaints, 10,000 points and they responded in less than a week. They also promised to upgrade me to the best available room if I ever stayed again.
reviews.title: Can't judge a book by its cover

likes.disliked: — The hotel facilities were poor overall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I would still recommend the Marriott. Its in a great location. I'm eager to see what the remodel is going to look like. Unless they've improved some of the other issues since my visit, you may have to pack your patience though.
reviews.title: Great time at The Marriott

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location for the Magnificent Mile, with helpful, attentive staff. However, both the public areas and rooms are rather outdated and in need of refurbishment. The lobby area is extremely noisey and not conducive to relaxation. it is more like a station concourse. There are better hotels in the area at the same price or lower. I am unlikely to stay here again.
reviews.title: Mediocre Marriott in a good location.

reviews.text: Stayed here on a business trip. The location of the hotel is excellent. It's within walking distance of most attractions. Very convenient. The hotel is older, but has been updated. The room was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Satisfied

reviews.text: This Marriott has a great location. It is right on Magnificent Mile so you are near a lot of shopping as well as the John Hancock Observatory. Lake Michigan is a few blocks away and you are also very close to the river and the great Chicago Architecture Foundation tour (by boat). Also within walking distance is the lively River North area where you will find popular restaurants from celebrity chefs Rick Bayless and Graham Elliot.
reviews.title: This Marriott has a great location, but the rooms are outdated

reviews.text: The hotel itself is not that great. The rooms are small (not too big of a deal) but very outdated. The A/C unit was not that great--the room did not quite get cool enough for me. If you are a Marriott Rewards Gold or Platinum member and are traveling with family, the Concierge Lounge is very family friendly; they do not seem to discourage guests and the menu seems to be family friendly (an assortment of pizzas one night, pasta the next night).
reviews.title: Great location, Great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Great location, family friendly (especially the Concierge Lounge), good customer service, reasonable room rates if you book well in advance
reviews.title: Strange Hotel Lobby

reviews.text: I would have given this hotel a better rating, had the HV/AC in my room been better. I was at the hotel for a conference. I would leave the room temp set at 60 every morning and when I would come back it would be HOT. 72 degrees with heat coming out the vent. I called down to the front desk and they told me that all the room are climate controlled at 72 degrees that means that even if you set the temp higher or lower, it won't work.....72 degrees! Why sets at room at 72?!?!?!...72 degrees is HOT and stuffy. The room was stuffy and although the bed was great it was very hot when I was sleeping. I couldn't even set the thermostat for the air or vent to circulate because only hot air came out. I met many other people staying at the hotel who had the same problem.
reviews.title: Great- except cannot control room temperature

aka: Marriott Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile Hotel Chicago
description: Encounter a renowned Chicago hotel combining the epitome of luxury and convenience at the Marriott Downtown Chicago Magnificent Mile Hotel, a Windy City landmark on Michigan Avenue's Magnificent Mile. Situated amongst world-class shopping and dining, this Chicago, Illinois hotel is in walking distance of top attractions, including Navy Pier, American Girl Place, Shedd Aquarium, Millennium Park, Theater and Museum Districts.
